definition: four legs facing the sky (idiom); flat on one's back
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards

sentences.english: His feet stuck up in the air.
The woman, sprawled on the ground, was seen wailing.
sentences.chinese: 这名女乘客四脚朝天地躺在地上，并在地上打滚哭闹。

sentences.english: The horse will slip up bad in the grass.
sentences.chinese: 那只马在草丛里，将跌个四脚朝天。

sentences.english: A man came and slammed the turtle out fall.
sentences.chinese: 一个汉子走过来，用力把海龟翻个四脚朝天。

sentences.english: He tried to jump high like the others, but he always fell.
sentences.chinese: 他想要跟别人一样跳很高，却总是摔得四脚朝天。

sentences.english: Luckily it didn't hurt his arms and brains but fell on his head.
sentences.chinese: 四脚朝天摔得巧，没伤胳膊没伤脑。

sentences.english: Sometimes, he twists his body like this and rolling on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 有时，也会出现这种扭曲身体四脚朝天的睡姿。

sentences.english: My foe outstretched beneath the tree.
sentences.chinese: 我的敌人四脚朝天树下躺。

sentences.english: Finally she is pushed to the ground and falls on her back.
sentences.chinese: 最后更被重重一推，四脚朝天摔在地上。

definition: to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
to fall flat on one's face (vulgar)
to fall flat on one's face
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to knock down/to knock over/to run over (sb)
